title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 270-10.5 - Discovery
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 270-10.5 - Discovery

State Regulations
(a) Notice to
produce. A party to a hearing under this Part, upon receipt of notice to
produce documents and things from any other party, shall furnish all such
requested items relevant to the proceeding within 10 days of receipt of such
notice. (b) Subpoenas. Consistent
with the CPLR, any attorney of record in a proceeding under this Part, or any
person designated by the commissioner for this purpose shall have the power to
issue subpoenas. A party who is not represented by an attorney may request the
hearing officer to issue a subpoena by submitting a petition stating the items
or witnesses needed by the party to present its case. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
270-10.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
